question:
In light of Bengaluru opening its first ‘Bus Priority Lanes’, consider the following statements:
  1. Ambulances are allowed on these bus priority lanes.
  2. Private vehicles using this lane will invite penalty under the Motor Vehicles Act.
Which of the above statements is/are true?
explanation: Statement 1 is correct: The Bus Priority Lanes were established to reduce the traffic congestion. Only the BMTC buses which are called ‘Nimbus’ will operate on these routes. The routes will also be open for ambulances and fire engines. These routes have been developed along 12 high density corridors.  Statement 2 is correct: Private vehicles aren’t allowed on these Bus Priority Lanes. Offenders are to be penalised under the ‘other offences’ category of the Motor Vehicles Act, 1988. First time offenders will face a fine of 500 INR and a fine of 1000 INR will be imposed on repeat offenders.
